intro: Nicolasia pedunculata, commonly known as the slender nicotiana, is a flowering plant belonging to the Solanaceae family. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant has hairy stems and leaves that are ovate to lanceolate in shape. It is native to South America and thrives in temperate climates with well-drained soil. Nicolasia pedunculata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in botanical research due to its unique floral structure.
